body_html:
PyTorch's python argument parsing doesn't handle varargs except in very special cases (ints and only varargs, no direct args).
I would have implemented it, but without having more than one function to use it, it didn't fly with @apaszke for the added complexity (which would involve allocating and deallocating the vararg vector where now the argument vector just doubles for the vararg vector).

body:
PyTorch's python argument parsing doesn't handle varargs except in very special cases (ints and only varargs, no direct args).
I would have implemented it, but without having more than one function to use it, it didn't fly with @apaszke for the added complexity (which would involve allocating and deallocating the vararg vector where now the argument vector just doubles for the vararg vector).
